<bill bill-stage="Introduced-in-Senate" public-private="public">
	<metadata xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">

<dc:title>113 S1328 IS: New Philadelphia, Illinois, Study Act</dc:title>
<dc:publisher>U.S. Senate</dc:publisher>
<dc:date>2013-07-18</dc:date>
<dc:format>text/xml</dc:format>

<form>
		<distribution-code display="yes">II</distribution-code>
		<congress>113th CONGRESS</congress>
		<session>1st Session</session>
		<legis-num>S. 1328</legis-num>
		<current-chamber>IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES</current-chamber>
		<action>
			<action-date date="20130718">July 18, 2013</action-date>
			<action-desc>
        <sponsor name-id="S339">Mr. Kirk</sponsor> (for himself
			 and <cosponsor name-id="S253">Mr. Durbin</cosponsor>) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the
			 <committee-name committee-id="SSEG00">Committee on Energy and Natural
			 Resources</committee-name>
      </action-desc>
		</action>
		<legis-type>A BILL</legis-type>
		<official-title>To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a
		  special resource study of the archeological site and surrounding land of the
		  New Philadelphia town site in the State of Illinois, and for other
		  purposes.</official-title>
	</form>
	<legis-body id="H9D3B4B70193943A9B8F54B62F3816AB3" style="OLC">
		<section id="H8ED0C4CA58C84BD3BF7D9E6A4C03F570" section-type="section-one">
      <enum>1.</enum>
      <header>Short title</header>
      <text display-inline="no-display-inline">This Act may be cited as the
			 <quote>
          <short-title>New Philadelphia, Illinois, Study
			 Act</short-title>
        </quote>.</text>
		</section>
    <section id="HD626AE713A4A417CABD79DB353AE0A8E">
      <enum>2.</enum>
      <header>Findings</header>
      <text display-inline="no-display-inline">
        <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="federal-body" entity-id="0001">Congress</cato:entity-ref> finds that—</text>
			<paragraph id="HF466BB30674B48DC8E2CD1A144401DD7">
        <enum>(1)</enum>
        <text>Frank McWorter, an
			 enslaved man, bought his freedom and the freedom of 15 family members by mining
			 for crude niter in Kentucky caves and processing the mined material into
			 saltpeter;</text>
			</paragraph>
      <paragraph id="HE24B4FCABBCA4608B7E7CEA7F7669B76">
        <enum>(2)</enum>
        <text>New Philadelphia,
			 founded in 1836 by Frank McWorter, was the first town planned and legally
			 registered by a free African-American before the Civil War;</text>
			</paragraph>
      <paragraph id="H79E9E24750254A68A174DD103887C16E">
        <enum>(3)</enum>
        <text>the first railroad
			 constructed in the area of New Philadelphia bypassed New Philadelphia, which
			 led to the decline of New Philadelphia; and</text>
			</paragraph>
      <paragraph id="HC7A29B29C42B440F920D82AF3BBCE485">
        <enum>(4)</enum>
        <text>the New
			 Philadelphia site—</text>
				<subparagraph id="H00A2FE056A0E499784BC63F61A225618">
          <enum>(A)</enum>
          <text>is a registered
			 National Historic Landmark;</text>
				</subparagraph>
        <subparagraph id="H654ED09F49DA4105933A782DDCF5861C">
          <enum>(B)</enum>
          <text>is covered by
			 farmland; and</text>
				</subparagraph>
        <subparagraph id="H1FE803EC55CA4898AFFDA2FFC76A988F">
          <enum>(C)</enum>
          <text>does not contain
			 any original buildings of the town or the McWorter farm and home that are
			 visible above ground.</text>
				</subparagraph>
      </paragraph>
    </section>
    <section id="HACB7EC2B3367446C997A8E03C62787A8">
      <enum>3.</enum>
      <header>Definitions</header>
      <text display-inline="no-display-inline">In this Act:</text>
			<paragraph id="HA0B04B72933F415DB13AC02EC566060A">
        <enum>(1)</enum>
        <header>Secretary</header>
        <text>The
			 term <term>Secretary</term> means the <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="federal-body" entity-id="1400">Secretary of the Interior</cato:entity-ref>.</text>
			</paragraph>
      <paragraph id="H984A2A4CD11C43B4B8AD24350C36D120">
        <enum>(2)</enum>
        <header>Study
			 Area</header>
        <text>The term <term>Study Area</term> means the New Philadelphia
			 archeological site and the surrounding land in the State of Illinois.</text>
			</paragraph>
    </section>
    <section id="H60E946510C9740E385A18149B6F397E6">
      <enum>4.</enum>
      <header>Special resource
			 study</header>
			<subsection id="HBCE89EE053E94B0D97DFC666EC25368E">
        <enum>(a)</enum>
        <header>Study</header>
        <text>The
			 <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="federal-body" entity-id="1400">Secretary</cato:entity-ref> shall conduct a special resource study of the Study Area.</text>
			</subsection>
      <subsection id="H0BA427F9036A4FB29CE6AFFAC6D17418">
        <enum>(b)</enum>
        <header>Contents</header>
        <text>In
			 conducting the study under <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="act" value="New Philadelphia, Illinois, Study Act/s:4/ss:a" proposed="true">subsection (a)</cato:entity-ref>, the <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="federal-body" entity-id="1400">Secretary</cato:entity-ref> shall—</text>
				<paragraph id="H07D6E02431854EDDA4472D2DB5286FC7">
          <enum>(1)</enum>
          <text>evaluate the
			 national significance of the Study Area;</text>
				</paragraph>
        <paragraph id="H561BFBA1A76445FE917E993203238FF5">
          <enum>(2)</enum>
          <text>determine the
			 suitability and feasibility of designating the Study Area as a unit of the
			 <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="federal-body" value="National Park System" entity-parent-id="1443">National Park System</cato:entity-ref>;</text>
				</paragraph>
        <paragraph id="HC2F698E5BF294AB4B9CCCC7AA2B6F0B9">
          <enum>(3)</enum>
          <text>consider other
			 alternatives for preservation, protection, and interpretation of the Study Area
			 by—</text>
					<subparagraph id="HF5D0F3C0C0F54B92A44706CDAECE6E63">
            <enum>(A)</enum>
            <text>Federal, State, or
			 local governmental entities; or</text>
					</subparagraph>
          <subparagraph id="H66E02A0B4F464367B1E1A05117C976A0">
            <enum>(B)</enum>
            <text>private and
			 nonprofit organizations;</text>
					</subparagraph>
        </paragraph>
        <paragraph id="HDF0116C8761744F1A647287D8113D87F">
          <enum>(4)</enum>
          <text>consult
			 with—</text>
					<subparagraph id="HA93F5DD18F5C4BB689C98EDD6DF7F525">
            <enum>(A)</enum>
            <text>interested
			 Federal, State, or local governmental entities;</text>
					</subparagraph>
          <subparagraph id="H0988B5472C6042D5B9D63B136AE50B66">
            <enum>(B)</enum>
            <text>private and
			 nonprofit organizations; or</text>
					</subparagraph>
          <subparagraph id="HB84FCD21D29D409A839176D9E93AFCBB">
            <enum>(C)</enum>
            <text>any other
			 interested individuals; and</text>
					</subparagraph>
        </paragraph>
        <paragraph id="H4E6ED4A013664005856655A6C10FE5EE">
          <enum>(5)</enum>
          <text>identify cost
			 estimates for any Federal acquisition, development, interpretation, operation,
			 and maintenance associated with the alternatives considered under <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="act" value="New Philadelphia, Illinois, Study Act/s:4/ss:b/p:3" proposed="true">paragraph
			 (3)</cato:entity-ref>.</text>
				</paragraph>
      </subsection>
      <subsection id="HD8F91DC17B3643F1A4620FCAE89BE8EF">
        <enum>(c)</enum>
        <header>Applicable
			 law</header>
        <text>The study required under <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="act" value="New Philadelphia, Illinois, Study Act/s:4/ss:a" proposed="true">subsection (a)</cato:entity-ref> shall be conducted in
			 accordance with <cato:entity xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="law-citation">
            <cato:entity-ref entity-type="public-law" value="public-law/91/383/s:8">section 8 of Public Law 91–383</cato:entity-ref> (<cato:entity-ref entity-type="uscode" value="usc/16/1a–5">16 U.S.C. 1a–5</cato:entity-ref>)</cato:entity>.</text>
			</subsection>
      <subsection id="H0CA44C10B6F843AF8E3DA3A90F528193">
        <enum>(d)</enum>
        <header>Report</header>
        <text>Not
			 later than 3 years after the date on which funds are first made available for
			 the study under <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="act" value="New Philadelphia, Illinois, Study Act/s:4/ss:a" proposed="true">subsection (a)</cato:entity-ref>, the <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="federal-body" entity-id="1400">Secretary</cato:entity-ref> shall submit to the <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="committee" entity-id="HII00">Committee on
			 Natural Resources of the House of Representatives</cato:entity-ref> and the <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="committee" entity-id="SSEG00">Committee on Energy
			 and Natural Resources of the Senate</cato:entity-ref> a report containing—</text>
				<paragraph id="H135EAF8EADB0454988BF556CD5112087">
          <enum>(1)</enum>
          <text>the results of the
			 study; and</text>
				</paragraph>
        <paragraph id="HFEF9826AFA1E4CC6933022FF3CE7CA29">
          <enum>(2)</enum>
          <text>any conclusions
			 and recommendations of the <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="federal-body" entity-id="1400">Secretary</cato:entity-ref>.</text>
				</paragraph>
      </subsection>
      <subsection id="idD35277E2BF6443A8925A21749C273B71">
        <enum>(e)</enum>
        <header>Funding</header>
        <text>The
			 study authorized under this section shall be carried out using existing funds
			 of the <cato:entity-ref xmlns:cato="http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml" entity-type="federal-body" entity-id="1443">National Park Service</cato:entity-ref>.</text>
			</subsection>
    </section>
  </legis-body>
</bill>
